Package xxl.cursors

This package extends the functionality of the classes Iterator and Enumeration.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Cursor The interface Cursor extends the interface PeekIterator.
Join Represents the logical join-operator (marker interface).
PeekIterator A PeekIterator over a collection.
Sorter Represents the logical sort-operator (marker interface).
SortMerge.SweepArea Represents a sweep-line status structure.
 

Class Summary
AbstractCursor The AbstractCursor implements most of the methods of the Cursor-interface and is useful in those cases when you produce elements and want to ³return³ them by a Cursor.
Aggregator The Aggregator computes an aggregate for an input-Iterator.
ArrayCursor The ArrayCursor constructs a Cursor for an arbitary given Array.
Bresenham Produces Integers according to Bresenham's algorithm.
BufferedCursor A BufferedCursor implements the peek-functionality.
Cursors This class contains various static methods for manipulating iterators.
DecoratorCursor This class decorates a Cursor passing by all its method calls.
DivideAndConquer Divide&Conquer paradigm.
Divider Divide&Conquer paradigm.
Divider.AssessmentFunction  
Dropper A Dropper drops a user-defined number of the given Iterator's elements.
EmptyCursor The EmptyCursor does not contain any elements.
Therefore hasNext() always returns false.
EnumerationCursor This class is a wrapper for the old Enumeration class.
Enumerator The Enumerator returns a sequence of Integer-objects of an optional given range.
Filter A Filter is a DecoratorCursor, that selects the Cursor's elements with the help of a user-defined (Boolean-)function or predicate.
Grouper A Grouper partitions input data into groups (lazy evaluation).
HashGrouper A HashGrouper partitions input data into groups (strict evaluation).
Inductor Given a tuple of start-values [a_0,...,a_n] the Inductor computes the value a_(n+1+i) (i>=0) by calling the Function next with parameters [a_i,...,a_(n+i)].
IteratorCursor The IteratorCursor wraps an Iterator to a Cursor.
IteratorEnumeration The IteratorEnumeration wraps an Iterator to an Enumeration.
Mapper The Mapper maps an input-Iterator-array to a Cursor by invoking a given Function.
Merger A Merger serializes inputs with respect to a given comparator.
MergeSorter External Merge-Sort based on Replacement Selection.
Minimator The Minimator is an Aggregator that computes the minimal object for a given input-Iterator.
MultiMapper The MultiMapper is a DecoratorCursor that maps an input-object of the input-Iterator to an Iterator of objects, that means it maps one to many.
NestedLoops This class provides a lazy NestedLoops-Join implementation for two cursors.
PeekIteratorCursor A PeekIteratorCursor wraps a PeekIterator to a Cursor.
Permutator The Permutator 'returns' a permutation of a given input-array or creates a permutation of Integers from [0,..n) by lazy evaluation.
RandomIntegers The RandomIntegers-Cursor returns random Integer-objects.
Remover The Remover is a DecoratorCursor that removes all elements of the input-Iterator, that means remove is called for all elements of the input-Iterator.
Repeater A Repeater repeats a given object n times.
ReplacementSelection Replacement Selection takes an Iterator as its input and creates sorted runs as its output.
Sampler A Sampler is backed on a given Input-Iterator and represents a sample of the underlying Iterator by returning every n-th element.
Sequentializer A Sequentializer concatenates n input-Cursors to a single Cursor.
SingleObjectCursor A SingleObjectCursor returns a user-specified object only for one time.
SortMerge This class provides a lazy SortMerge-Join implementation for two cursors.
Taker A Taker is a DecoratorCursor that returns the next n elements of a given Iterator (lazy evaluation).
TempCursor A TempCursor doubles a given input-Iterator by providing a method named cursor that returns one instance of a BufferedCursor containg all the elements that the decorated input-Iterator (TempCursor.this) returned by calls to next().
UnmodifiableCursor This class decorates a Cursor by preventing calls to remove and update.
WhileDropper The Dropper drops/swallows elements until/as long as the given (Boolean-)function's result or a predicate is equal to the user specified flag.
WhileRemover A WhileRemover removes the elements of an input-Iterator with the help of a user-defined predicate.
WhileTaker A WhileTaker selects the elements of an input-Cursor with the help of a (Boolean-)function or a predicate.
 

Package xxl.cursors Description

This package extends the functionality of the classes Iterator and Enumeration.
